conclusion: The task is to predict which container (E or F) liquid from A, B, C, and D will flow into after passing through baffles.
The first image shows the initial setup with colored markers labeling various positions (A, B, C, D, E, and F) and slanted baffles of different colors.
The second image shows liquid flowing from the top containers (A, B, C, and D) toward the bottom containers (E and F).
Container A is green, Container B is yellow, Container C is blue, and Container D is white.
Container E is on the left, and Container F is on the right at the bottom of the setup.
There is a green baffle angled toward the left below Container A.
There is a teal baffle angled toward the right below Container B.
There is no baffle directly below Container D.

premise: Liquid starts at Container A and encounters the green baffle angled toward the left.
conclusion: Liquid from Container A is deflected toward the left.

premise: Liquid from Container A is deflected toward the left.
conclusion: Liquid from Container A flows toward Container E.

premise: Liquid starts at Container B and encounters the teal baffle angled toward the right.
conclusion: Liquid from Container B is deflected toward the right.

premise: Liquid from Container B is deflected toward the right.
conclusion: Liquid from Container B flows toward Container F.

premise: Liquid starts at Container C and flows downward in a nearly straight line.
conclusion: Liquid from Container C flows toward the right.

premise: Liquid from Container C flows toward the right.
conclusion: Liquid from Container C flows toward Container F.

premise: Liquid starts at Container D and flows straight downward without encountering any baffles.
conclusion: Liquid from Container D flows straight downward.

premise: Liquid from Container D flows straight downward.
conclusion: Liquid from Container D flows toward Container F.

premise: Liquid from Container A is deflected toward the left, but some droplets may deviate.
conclusion: Some droplets from Container A may reach Container E.
